title: Jeremy Swayman shares humorous response to regrettable goal in first Olympic start
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Jeremy Swayman allowed a center-ice goal in Team USA's win over Denmark during the Olympic preliminary game.
Swayman jokingly dismissed speculation about black boards affecting his visibility by noting he's colorblind.
Despite Swayman's performance, Team USA secured a win, with Swayman making only 18 saves in the match.

title: NBA stars and legends weigh in on Jayson Tatum’s potential return this season
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Kevin Durant and Carmelo Anthony express optimism about Jayson Tatum's potential return to the Celtics after his Achilles injury.
Kevin Durant, who had an Achilles injury himself, expects All-Star level play from Tatum upon his return.
Tatum has been practicing with the Celtics' G League affiliate, raising hopes of a return before the playoffs.

title: 5 free agents that might make the most sense for Patriots to pursue at positions of need
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Patriots have $41 million in cap space to address key needs this offseason.
Top free-agent targets include Colts WR Alec Pierce and Packers OT Rasheed Walker.
Eagles EDGE Jaelan Phillips and Ravens TE Isaiah Likely are also potential fits for Patriots.

title: Making some sense of the new ESPN/MLB.TV streaming partnership and what it means to fans
author: Chad Finn
bullets: ESPN and MLB.TV announced a partnership making ESPN the streaming home for MLB games starting this season.
MLB.TV costs $134.99 for ESPN Unlimited subscribers and $149.99 for non-subscribers, with a free month of ESPN Unlimited.
Current MLB.TV accounts will renew automatically; new subscribers must register via the ESPN app but don't need ESPN Unlimited.

title: ‘We’re real excited’: Celtics’ Ron Harper Jr. shares Jayson Tatum looked like himself in recent G League practice
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jayson Tatum participated in a practice with the Celtics' G League team, fueling speculation about his season return.
Ron Harper Jr. expressed excitement over Tatum's performance, though Tatum remains officially ruled out by the Celtics.
Celtics President Brad Stevens stated Tatum won't return until fully ready; he resumed five-on-five scrimmages recently.

title: Here’s where Mass. finished on the latest list of most educated states
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Massachusetts ranked as the most educated state in WalletHub's 2026 'Most & Least Educated States in America' study.
Massachusetts leads with over 47% holding bachelor's degrees and nearly 22% having graduate or professional degrees.
Vermont and Maryland ranked second and third, while Louisiana, Mississippi, and West Virginia were ranked lowest.

title: One of the rarest baseball cards is up for auction â€” and there are local connections
author: Lauren Daley
bullets: A rare Honus Wagner T206 baseball card owned by the Bernstein family of Taunton is up for auction.
The card was discovered by Ken Goldin and is expected to fetch over $6 million due to its rarity.
The auction, featured on Netflix's "King of Collectibles," closes on February 21 with a current bid of $3.9 million.

title: Bruins G Jeremy Swayman set to make Olympic debut and start for Team USA vs. Denmark
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Bruins goalie Jeremy Swayman will make his Olympic debut starting for Team USA against Denmark on Saturday.
Swayman helped Team USA win the 2025 IIHF World Championship, contributing to his selection for the 2026 Olympics.
Swayman is joined by Bruins teammate Charlie McAvoy, who is set to play in Team USA's defense against Denmark.

title: New England Aquarium IDs right whale found dead off Virginia
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: A 3-year-old right whale found dead off Virginia was identified as the calf of whale #3293 Porcia by New England Aquarium.
This is the second right whale death in two weeks, highlighting the ongoing endangered status of this species.
The North Atlantic right whale population faces threats from fishing gear entanglements, with only 380 individuals remaining.

title: Another child has died of the flu in Mass.
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Seven children have died from influenza in Massachusetts this season according to state health data.
Massachusetts reported 260 total flu-related deaths this season, with 253 adults and 7 children deceased.
State health officials urge vaccination as flu activity strains hospitals despite declining cases in February.
